intro: [WRONG START] Embilia spiraeoides, commonly known as the Indian gooseberry or amla, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Indian subcontinent. It is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that turn from green to orange-red as they mature. These fruits are rich in vitamin C and have been used in traditional medicine for centuries. Botanically, it belongs to the family Ericaceae and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
